subject: Business
title: Tax Deductions vs. Tax Credits
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Tax Deductions vs. Tax Credits.

hook.text: A $1,000 deduction saves you $220. A $1,000 credit saves you $1,000. The difference is enormous.

buildup.text: Deductions reduce taxable income. Credits reduce the actual tax owed, dollar for dollar.

discovery.text: Common deductions: mortgage interest, charity. Common credits: child tax credit, education.

twist.text: Many people miss credits they qualify for. The IRS estimates billions go unclaimed yearly.

climax.text: The earned income tax credit lifts millions out of poverty. It can be worth over $7,000.

punchline.text: Credits beat deductions. Know which you qualify for.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between a tax deduction and a tax credit?
options: Deductions reduce taxable income; credits reduce tax owed dollar-for-dollar
